pullRequest.title: Kafka+Panache Quickstart + Various improvements
pullRequest.bodyText:
This PR:

improves a bit the different messaging quickstarts (new API, proper usage of test resources)
add a new quickstart demonstrating the usage of Panache and Reactive Message (Kafka)

Documentation PR: quarkusio/quarkus#9793
Checklist:
Your pull request:

 targets the development branch
 uses the 999-SNAPSHOT version of Quarkus
 has tests (mvn clean test)
 works in native (mvn clean package -Pnative)
 has native tests (mvn clean verify -Pnative)
 makes sure the documentation must not be updated
 links the documentation update pull request (if needed)
 updates or creates the README.md file (with build and run instructions)
 For new quickstart, is located in the directory component-quickstart
 For new quickstart, is added to the root pom.xml and README.md

commit.message:
Improve the Kafka and Database resources

* Return the properties (instead of defining the system properties)
* Fix generics

Improve the messaging quickstart

* acknowledge the messages
* use the new Channel class
* Remove the usage of RX Java and use Mutiny instead

@@ -0,0 +1,37 @@
+Quarkus Kafka/Panache Quickstart
+================================
+
+This project illustrates how you can interact with Apache Kafka using MicroProfile Reactive Messaging and Hibernate with Panache.
+
+## Infrastructure
+
+You need a PostGreSQL instance and a Kafka broker.
+To start them, just run `docker-compose up -d`.
+
+## Start the application
+
+The application can be started using: 
+
+```bash
+mvn quarkus:dev
+```  
+
+Then, open your browser to `http://localhost:8080/prices`, and you should get the set of prices written in the database.
+Every 5 seconds, a new price is generated, send to a Kafka topic, receive by a Kafka consumer and written to the database.

commit.message: Add a new quickstart demonstrating the usage of Reactive Messaging (Kafka) and Hibernate with Panache.
